013package org.apache.juneau.junit.bct;
014
015import static java.util.Optional.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.junit.bct.Utils.*;
017import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
018
019import java.io.*;
020import java.lang.reflect.*;
021import java.util.*;
022import java.util.concurrent.*;
023import java.util.function.*;
024import java.util.stream.*;
025
026/**
027 * Default implementation of {@link BeanConverter} for Bean-Centric Test (BCT) object conversion.
028 *
029 * <p>This class provides a comprehensive, extensible framework for converting Java objects to strings
030 * and lists, with sophisticated property access capabilities. It's the core engine behind BCT testing
031 * assertions, handling complex object introspection and value extraction with high performance through
032 * intelligent caching and optimized lookup strategies.</p>
033 *
034 * <h5 class='section'>Key Features:</h5>
035 * <ul>
036 *    <li><b>Extensible Type Handlers:</b> Pluggable stringifiers, listifiers, and swappers for custom types</li>
037 *    <li><b>Performance Optimization:</b> ConcurrentHashMap caching for type-to-handler mappings</li>
038 *    <li><b>Comprehensive Defaults:</b> Built-in support for all common Java types and structures</li>
039 *    <li><b>Configurable Settings:</b> Customizable formatting, delimiters, and display options</li>
040 *    <li><b>Thread Safety:</b> Fully thread-safe implementation suitable for concurrent testing</li>
041 * </ul>
042 *
043 * <h5 class='section'>Architecture Overview:</h5>
044 * <p>The converter uses four types of pluggable handlers:</p>
045 * <dl>
046 *    <dt><b>Stringifiers:</b></dt>
047 *    <dd>Convert objects to string representations with custom formatting rules</dd>
048 *
049 *    <dt><b>Listifiers:</b></dt>
050 *    <dd>Convert collection-like objects to List&lt;Object&gt; for uniform iteration</dd>
051 *
052 *    <dt><b>Swappers:</b></dt>
053 *    <dd>Pre-process objects before conversion (unwrap Optional, call Supplier, etc.)</dd>
054 *
055 *    <dt><b>PropertyExtractors:</b></dt>
056 *    <dd>Define custom property access strategies for nested field navigation (e.g., <js>"user.address.city"</js>)</dd>
057 * </dl>
058 *
059 * <p>PropertyExtractors use a chain-of-responsibility pattern, where each extractor in the chain
060 * is tried until one can handle the property access. The framework includes built-in extractors for:</p>
061 * <ul>
062 *    <li><b>JavaBean properties:</b> Standard getter methods and public fields</li>
063 *    <li><b>Collection/Array access:</b> Numeric indices and size/length properties</li>
064 *    <li><b>Map access:</b> Key-based property retrieval and size property</li>
065 * </ul>
066 *
067 * <h5 class='section'>Default Type Support:</h5>
068 * <p>Out-of-the-box stringification support includes:</p>
069 * <ul>
070 *    <li><b>Collections:</b> List, Set, Queue → <js>"[item1,item2,item3]"</js> format</li>
071 *    <li><b>Maps:</b> Map, Properties → <js>"{key1=value1,key2=value2}"</js> format</li>
072 *    <li><b>Map Entries:</b> Map.Entry → <js>"key=value"</js> format</li>
073 *    <li><b>Arrays:</b> All array types → <js>"[element1,element2]"</js> format</li>
074 *    <li><b>Dates:</b> Date, Calendar → ISO-8601 format</li>
075 *    <li><b>Files/Streams:</b> File, InputStream, Reader → content as hex or text</li>
076 *    <li><b>Reflection:</b> Class, Method, Constructor → human-readable signatures</li>
077 *    <li><b>Enums:</b> Enum values → name() format</li>
078 * </ul>
079 *
080 * <p>Default listification support includes:</p>
081 * <ul>
082 *    <li><b>Collection types:</b> List, Set, Queue, and all subtypes</li>
083 *    <li><b>Iterable objects:</b> Any Iterable implementation</li>
084 *    <li><b>Iterators:</b> Iterator and Enumeration (consumed to list)</li>
085 *    <li><b>Streams:</b> Stream objects (terminated to list)</li>
086 *    <li><b>Optional:</b> Empty list or single-element list</li>
087 *    <li><b>Maps:</b> Converted to list of Map.Entry objects</li>
088 * </ul>
089 *
090 * <p>Default swapping support includes:</p>
091 * <ul>
092 *    <li><b>Optional:</b> Unwrapped to contained value or <jk>null</jk></li>
093 *    <li><b>Supplier:</b> Called to get supplied value</li>
094 *    <li><b>Future:</b> Extracts completed result or returns <js>"&lt;pending&gt;"</js> for incomplete futures (via {@link Swappers#futureSwapper()})</li>
095 * </ul>
096 *
097 * <h5 class='section'>Configuration Settings:</h5>
098 * <p>The converter supports extensive customization via settings:</p>
099 * <dl>
100 *    <dt><code>nullValue</code></dt>
101 *    <dd>String representation for null values (default: <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js>)</dd>
102 *
103 *    <dt><code>selfValue</code></dt>
104 *    <dd>Special property name that returns the object itself (default: <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>)</dd>
105 *
106 *    <dt><code>emptyValue</code></dt>
107 *    <dd>String representation for empty collections (default: <js>"&lt;empty&gt;"</js>)</dd>
108 *
109 *    <dt><code>fieldSeparator</code></dt>
110 *    <dd>Delimiter between collection elements and map entries (default: <js>","</js>)</dd>
111 *
112 *    <dt><code>collectionPrefix/Suffix</code></dt>
113 *    <dd>Brackets around collection content (default: <js>"["</js> and <js>"]"</js>)</dd>
114 *
115 *    <dt><code>mapPrefix/Suffix</code></dt>
116 *    <dd>Brackets around map content (default: <js>"{"</js> and <js>"}"</js>)</dd>
117 *
118 *    <dt><code>mapEntrySeparator</code></dt>
119 *    <dd>Separator between map keys and values (default: <js>"="</js>)</dd>
120 *
121 *    <dt><code>calendarFormat</code></dt>
122 *    <dd>DateTimeFormatter for calendar objects (default: <jsf>ISO_INSTANT</jsf>)</dd>
123 *
124 *    <dt><code>classNameFormat</code></dt>
125 *    <dd>Format for class names: <js>"simple"</js>, <js>"canonical"</js>, or <js>"full"</js> (default: <js>"simple"</js>)</dd>
126 * </dl>
127 *
128 * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
129 *
130 * <p><b>Basic Usage with Defaults:</b></p>
131 * <p class='bjava'>
132 *    <jc>// Use default converter</jc>
133 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>converter</jv> = BasicBeanConverter.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>;
134 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>result</jv> = <jv>converter</jv>.stringify(<jv>myObject</jv>);
135 * </p>
136 *
137 * <p><b>Custom Configuration:</b></p>
138 * <p class='bjava'>
139 *    <jc>// Build custom converter</jc>
140 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>converter</jv> = BasicBeanConverter.<jsm>builder</jsm>()
141 *       .defaultSettings()
142 *       .addSetting(<jsf>SETTING_nullValue</jsf>, <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js>)
143 *       .addSetting(<jsf>SETTING_fieldSeparator</jsf>, <js>" | "</js>)
144 *       .addStringifier(MyClass.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>obj</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) -> <js>"MyClass["</js> + <jp>obj</jp>.getName() + <js>"]"</js>)
145 *       .addListifier(MyIterable.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>obj</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) -> <jp>obj</jp>.toList())
146 *       .addSwapper(MyWrapper.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>obj</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) -> <jp>obj</jp>.getWrapped())
147 *       .build();
148 * </p>
149 *
150 * <p><b>Complex Property Access:</b></p>
151 * <p class='bjava'>
152 *    <jc>// Extract nested properties</jc>
153 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>name</jv> = <jv>converter</jv>.getEntry(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"name"</js>);
154 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>city</jv> = <jv>converter</jv>.getEntry(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"address.city"</js>);
155 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>firstOrder</jv> = <jv>converter</jv>.getEntry(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"orders.0.id"</js>);
156 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>orderCount</jv> = <jv>converter</jv>.getEntry(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"orders.length"</js>);
157 * </p>
158 *
159 * <p><b>Special Property Values:</b></p>
160 * <p class='bjava'>
161 *    <jc>// Use special property names</jc>
162 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>userObj</jv> = <jv>converter</jv>.getEntry(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"&lt;self&gt;"</js>); <jc>// Returns the user object itself</jc>
163 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>nullValue</jv> = <jv>converter</jv>.getEntry(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js>); <jc>// Returns null</jc>
164 *
165 *    <jc>// Custom self value</jc>
166 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>customConverter</jv> = BasicBeanConverter.<jsm>builder</jsm>()
167 *       .defaultSettings()
168 *       .addSetting(<jsf>SETTING_selfValue</jsf>, <js>"this"</js>)
169 *       .build();
170 *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>selfRef</jv> = <jv>customConverter</jv>.getEntry(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"this"</js>); <jc>// Returns user object</jc>
171 * </p>
172 *
173 * <h5 class='section'>Performance Characteristics:</h5>
174 * <ul>
175 *    <li><b>Handler Lookup:</b> O(1) average case via ConcurrentHashMap caching</li>
176 *    <li><b>Type Registration:</b> Handlers checked in reverse registration order (last wins)</li>
177 *    <li><b>Inheritance Support:</b> Handlers support class inheritance and interface implementation</li>
178 *    <li><b>Thread Safety:</b> Full concurrency support with no locking overhead after initialization</li>
179 *    <li><b>Memory Efficiency:</b> Minimal object allocation during normal operation</li>
180 * </ul>
181 *
182 * <h5 class='section'>Extension Patterns:</h5>
183 *
184 * <p><b>Custom Type Stringification:</b></p>
185 * <p class='bjava'>
186 *    <jv>builder</jv>.addStringifier(LocalDateTime.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>dt</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) ->
187 *       <jp>dt</jp>.format(DateTimeFormatter.<jsf>ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME</jsf>));
188 * </p>
189 *
190 * <p><b>Custom Collection Handling:</b></p>
191 * <p class='bjava'>
192 *    <jv>builder</jv>.addListifier(MyCustomCollection.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>coll</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) ->
193 *       <jp>coll</jp>.stream().map(<jp>conv</jp>::swap).toList());
194 * </p>
195 *
196 * <p><b>Custom Object Transformation:</b></p>
197 * <p class='bjava'>
198 *    <jv>builder</jv>.addSwapper(LazyValue.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>lazy</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) ->
199 *       <jp>lazy</jp>.isEvaluated() ? <jp>lazy</jp>.getValue() : "&lt;unevaluated&gt;");
200 * </p>
201 *
202 * <h5 class='section'>Integration with BCT:</h5>
203 * <p>This class is used internally by all BCT assertion methods in {@link BctAssertions}:</p>
204 * <ul>
205 *    <li>{@link BctAssertions#assertBean(Object, String, String)} - Uses getEntry() for property access</li>
206 *    <li>{@link BctAssertions#assertList(List, Object...)} - Uses stringify() for element comparison</li>
207 *    <li>{@link BctAssertions#assertBeans(Collection, String, String...)} - Uses both getEntry() and stringify()</li>
208 * </ul>
209 *
210 * @see BeanConverter
211 */
212@SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
213public class BasicBeanConverter implements BeanConverter {
214
215   public static final BasicBeanConverter DEFAULT = builder().defaultSettings().build();
216
217   public static final String
218      SETTING_nullValue = "nullValue",
219      SETTING_selfValue = "selfValue",
220      SETTING_fieldSeparator = "fieldSeparator",
221      SETTING_collectionPrefix = "collectionPrefix",
222      SETTING_collectionSuffix = "collectionSuffix",
223      SETTING_mapPrefix = "mapPrefix",
224      SETTING_mapSuffix = "mapSuffix",
225      SETTING_mapEntrySeparator = "mapEntrySeparator",
226      SETTING_calendarFormat = "calendarFormat",
227      SETTING_classNameFormat = "classNameFormat";
228
229   private final List<StringifierEntry<?>> stringifiers;
230   private final List<ListifierEntry<?>> listifiers;
231   private final List<SwapperEntry<?>> swappers;
232   private final List<PropertyExtractor> propertyExtractors;
233   private final Map<String,Object> settings;
234
235   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Class,Optional<Stringifier<?>>> stringifierMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
236   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Class,Optional<Listifier<?>>> listifierMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
237   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Class,Optional<Swapper<?>>> swapperMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
238
239   protected BasicBeanConverter(Builder b) {
240      stringifiers = new ArrayList<>(b.stringifiers);
241      listifiers = new ArrayList<>(b.listifiers);
242      swappers = new ArrayList<>(b.swappers);
243      propertyExtractors = new ArrayList<>(b.propertyExtractors);
244      settings = new HashMap<>(b.settings);
245      Collections.reverse(stringifiers);
246      Collections.reverse(listifiers);
247      Collections.reverse(swappers);
248      Collections.reverse(propertyExtractors);
249   }
250
251   /**
252    * Creates a new builder for configuring a BasicBeanConverter instance.
253    *
254    * <p>The builder allows registration of custom stringifiers, listifiers, and swappers,
255    * as well as configuration of various formatting settings before building the converter.</p>
256    *
257    * @return A new Builder instance
258    */
259   public static Builder builder() {
260      return new Builder();
261   }
262
263   @Override
264   public String stringify(Object o) {
265      o = swap(o);
266      if (o == null)
267         return getSetting(SETTING_nullValue, null);
268      var c = o.getClass();
269      var stringifier = stringifierMap.computeIfAbsent(c, this::findStringifier);
270      if (stringifier.isEmpty()) {
271         stringifier = of(canListify(o) ? (bc, o2) -> bc.stringify(bc.listify(o2)) : (bc, o2) -> safeToString(o2));
272         stringifierMap.putIfAbsent(c, stringifier);
273      }
274      var o2 = o;
275      return stringifier.map(x -> (Stringifier)x).map(x -> x.apply(this, o2)).map(Utils::safeToString).orElse(null);
276   }
277
278   @Override
279   public Object swap(Object o) {
280      if (o == null) return null;
281      var c = o.getClass();
282      var swapper = swapperMap.computeIfAbsent(c, this::findSwapper);
283      if (swapper.isPresent())
284         return swap(swapper.map(x -> (Swapper)x).map(x -> x.apply(this, o)).orElse(null));
285      return o;
286   }
287
288   @Override
289   public List<Object> listify(Object o) {
290      assertArgNotNull("o", o);
291      o = swap(o);
292      if (o instanceof List)
293         return (List<Object>)o;
294      var c = o.getClass();
295      if (c.isArray())
296         return arrayToList(o);
297      var o2 = o;
298      return listifierMap.computeIfAbsent(c, this::findListifier).map(x -> (Listifier)x).map(x -> (List<Object>)x.apply(this, o2)).orElseThrow(()->new IllegalArgumentException(f("Object of type {0} could not be converted to a list.", t(o2))));
299   }
300
301   @Override
302   public boolean canListify(Object o) {
303      o = swap(o);
304      if (o == null)
305         return false;
306      var c = o.getClass();
307      return o instanceof List || c.isArray() || listifierMap.computeIfAbsent(c, this::findListifier).isPresent();
308   }
309
310   @Override
311   public Object getProperty(Object object, String name) {
312      var o = swap(object);
313      return propertyExtractors
314         .stream()
315         .filter(x -> x.canExtract(this, o, name))
316         .findFirst()
317         .orElseThrow(()->new RuntimeException(f("Could not find extractor for object of type {0}", o.getClass().getName())))
318         .extract(this, o, name);
319   }
320
321   @Override
322   public String getNested(Object o, NestedTokenizer.Token token) {
323      assertArgNotNull("token", token);
324
325      if (o == null) return getSetting(SETTING_nullValue, null);
326
327      // Handle #{...} syntax for iterating over collections/arrays
328      if (eq("#", token.getValue()) && canListify(o)) {
329         return listify(o).stream().map(x -> token.getNested().stream().map(x2 -> getNested(x, x2)).collect(joining(",","{","}"))).collect(joining(",","[","]"));
330      }
331
332      // Original logic for regular property access
333      var pn = token.getValue();
334      var selfValue = getSetting(SETTING_selfValue, "<self>");
335
336      // Handle special values
337      Object e;
338      if (pn.equals(selfValue)) {
339         e = o; // Return the object itself
340      } else {
341         e = ofNullable(getProperty(o, pn)).orElse(null);
342      }
343      if (e == null || ! token.hasNested()) return stringify(e);
344      return token.getNested().stream().map(x -> getNested(e, x)).map(this::stringify).collect(joining(",","{","}"));
345   }
346
347   private Optional<Stringifier<?>> findStringifier(Class<?> c) {
348      if (c == null)
349         return empty();
350      var s = stringifiers.stream().filter(x -> x.forClass.isAssignableFrom(c)).findFirst().orElse(null);
351      if (s != null)
352         return of(s.function);
353      return findStringifier(c.getSuperclass());
354   }
355
356   private Optional<Listifier<?>> findListifier(Class<?> c) {
357      if (c == null)
358         return empty();
359      var l = listifiers.stream().filter(x -> x.forClass.isAssignableFrom(c)).findFirst().orElse(null);
360      if (l != null)
361         return of(l.function);
362      return findListifier(c.getSuperclass());
363   }
364
365   private Optional<Swapper<?>> findSwapper(Class<?> c) {
366      if (c == null)
367         return empty();
368      var s = swappers.stream().filter(x -> x.forClass.isAssignableFrom(c)).findFirst().orElse(null);
369      if (s != null)
370         return of(s.function);
371      return findSwapper(c.getSuperclass());
372   }
373
374   @Override
375   public <T> T getSetting(String key, T def) {
376      return (T)settings.getOrDefault(key, def);
377   }
378
379   /**
380    * Builder class for configuring BasicBeanConverter instances.
381    *
382    * <p>This builder provides a fluent interface for registering custom type handlers
383    * and configuring conversion settings. All registration methods support method chaining
384    * for convenient configuration.</p>
385    *
386    * <h5 class='section'>Handler Registration:</h5>
387    * <ul>
388    *    <li><b>Stringifiers:</b> Custom string conversion logic for specific types</li>
389    *    <li><b>Listifiers:</b> Custom list conversion logic for collection-like types</li>
390    *    <li><b>Swappers:</b> Pre-processing transformation logic for wrapper types</li>
391    * </ul>
392    *
393    * <h5 class='section'>Registration Order:</h5>
394    * <p>Handlers are checked in reverse registration order (last registered wins).
395    * This allows overriding default handlers by registering more specific ones later.</p>
396    *
397    * <h5 class='section'>Inheritance Support:</h5>
398    * <p>All handlers support class inheritance and interface implementation.
399    * When looking up a handler, the system checks:</p>
400    * <ol>
401    *    <li>Exact class match</li>
402    *    <li>Interface matches (in order of interface declaration)</li>
403    *    <li>Superclass matches (walking up the inheritance hierarchy)</li>
404    * </ol>
405    *
406    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Example:</h5>
407    * <p class='bjava'>
408    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>converter</jv> = BasicBeanConverter.<jsm>builder</jsm>()
409    *       .defaultSettings()
410    *       <jc>// Custom stringification for LocalDateTime</jc>
411    *       .addStringifier(LocalDateTime.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>dt</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) ->
412    *          <jp>dt</jp>.format(DateTimeFormatter.<jsf>ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME</jsf>))
413    *
414    *       <jc>// Custom collection handling for custom type</jc>
415    *       .addListifier(MyIterable.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>iter</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) ->
416    *          <jp>iter</jp>.stream().collect(toList()))
417    *
418    *       <jc>// Custom transformation for wrapper type</jc>
419    *       .addSwapper(LazyValue.<jk>class</jk>, (<jp>lazy</jp>, <jp>conv</jp>) ->
420    *          <jp>lazy</jp>.isComputed() ? <jp>lazy</jp>.get() : <jk>null</jk>)
421    *
422    *       <jc>// Configure settings</jc>
423    *       .addSetting(<jsf>SETTING_nullValue</jsf>, <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js>)
424    *       .addSetting(<jsf>SETTING_fieldSeparator</jsf>, <js>" | "</js>)
425    *
426    *       <jc>// Add default handlers for common types</jc>
427    *       .defaultSettings()
428    *       .build();
429    * </p>
430    */
431
432   /**
433    * Builder for creating customized BasicBeanConverter instances.
434    *
435    * <p>This builder provides a fluent API for configuring custom type handlers, settings,
436    * and property extraction logic. The builder supports registration of four main types
437    * of customizations:</p>
438    *
439    * <h5 class='section'>Type Handlers:</h5>
440    * <ul>
441    *    <li><b>{@link #addStringifier(Class, Stringifier)}</b> - Custom string conversion logic</li>
442    *    <li><b>{@link #addListifier(Class, Listifier)}</b> - Custom list conversion for collection-like objects</li>
443    *    <li><b>{@link #addSwapper(Class, Swapper)}</b> - Pre-processing and object transformation</li>
444    *    <li><b>{@link #addPropertyExtractor(PropertyExtractor)}</b> - Custom property access strategies</li>
445    * </ul>
446    *
447    * <h5 class='section'>PropertyExtractors:</h5>
448    * <p>Property extractors define how the converter accesses object properties during nested
449    * field access (e.g., {@code "user.address.city"}). The converter uses a chain-of-responsibility
450    * pattern, trying each registered extractor until one succeeds:</p>
451    *
452    * <ul>
453    *    <li><b>{@link PropertyExtractors.ObjectPropertyExtractor}</b> - JavaBean-style properties via reflection</li>
454    *    <li><b>{@link PropertyExtractors.ListPropertyExtractor}</b> - Numeric indices and size/length for arrays/collections</li>
455    *    <li><b>{@link PropertyExtractors.MapPropertyExtractor}</b> - Key-based access for Map objects</li>
456    * </ul>
457    *
458    * <p>Custom extractors can be added to handle specialized property access patterns:</p>
459    * <p class='bjava'>
460    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>converter</jv> = BasicBeanConverter.<jsm>builder</jsm>()
461    *       .defaultSettings()
462    *       .addPropertyExtractor(<jk>new</jk> MyCustomExtractor())
463    *       .addPropertyExtractor((<jp>obj</jp>, <jp>prop</jp>) -&gt; {
464    *          <jk>if</jk> (<jp>obj</jp> <jk>instanceof</jk> MySpecialType <jv>special</jv>) {
465    *             <jk>return</jk> <jv>special</jv>.getCustomProperty(<jp>prop</jp>);
466    *          }
467    *          <jk>return</jk> <jk>null</jk>; <jc>// Try next extractor</jc>
468    *       })
469    *       .build();
470    * </p>
471    *
472    * <h5 class='section'>Default Configuration:</h5>
473    * <p>The {@link #defaultSettings()} method pre-registers comprehensive type handlers
474    * and property extractors for common Java types, providing out-of-the-box functionality
475    * for most use cases while still allowing full customization.</p>
476    *
477    * @see PropertyExtractors
478    * @see PropertyExtractor
479    */
480   public static class Builder {
481      private Map<String,Object> settings = new HashMap<>();
482      private List<StringifierEntry<?>> stringifiers = new ArrayList<>();
483      private List<ListifierEntry<?>> listifiers = new ArrayList<>();
484      private List<SwapperEntry<?>> swappers = new ArrayList<>();
485      private List<PropertyExtractor> propertyExtractors = new ArrayList<>();
486
487      /**
488       * Adds a configuration setting to the converter.
489       *
490       * @param key The setting key (use SETTING_* constants)
491       * @param value The setting value
492       * @return This builder for method chaining
493       */
494      public Builder addSetting(String key, Object value) { settings.put(key, value); return this; }
495
496      /**
497       * Registers a custom stringifier for a specific type.
498       *
499       * <p>Stringifiers convert objects to their string representations. The BiFunction
500       * receives the object to convert and the converter instance for recursive calls.</p>
501       *
502       * @param <T> The type to handle
503       * @param c The class to register the stringifier for
504       * @param s The stringification function
505       * @return This builder for method chaining
506       */
507      public <T> Builder addStringifier(Class<T> c, Stringifier<T> s) { stringifiers.add(new StringifierEntry<>(c, s)); return this; }
508
509      /**
510       * Registers a custom listifier for a specific type.
511       *
512       * <p>Listifiers convert collection-like objects to List&lt;Object&gt;. The BiFunction
513       * receives the object to convert and the converter instance for recursive calls.</p>
514       *
515       * @param <T> The type to handle
516       * @param c The class to register the listifier for
517       * @param l The listification function
518       * @return This builder for method chaining
519       */
520      public <T> Builder addListifier(Class<T> c, Listifier<T> l) { listifiers.add(new ListifierEntry<>(c, l)); return this; }
521
522      /**
523       * Registers a custom swapper for a specific type.
524       *
525       * <p>Swappers pre-process objects before conversion. Common uses include
526       * unwrapping Optional values, calling Supplier methods, or extracting values
527       * from wrapper objects.</p>
528       *
529       * @param <T> The type to handle
530       * @param c The class to register the swapper for
531       * @param s The swapping function
532       * @return This builder for method chaining
533       */
534      public <T> Builder addSwapper(Class<T> c, Swapper<T> s) { swappers.add(new SwapperEntry<>(c, s)); return this; }
535
536      /**
537       * Registers a custom property extractor for specialized property access logic.
538       *
539       * <p>Property extractors enable custom property access patterns beyond standard JavaBean
540       * conventions. The converter tries extractors in registration order until one returns
541       * a non-<jk>null</jk> value. This allows for:</p>
542       * <ul>
543       *    <li><b>Custom data structures:</b> Special property access for non-standard objects</li>
544       *    <li><b>Database entities:</b> Property access via entity-specific methods</li>
545       *    <li><b>Dynamic properties:</b> Computed or cached property values</li>
546       *    <li><b>Legacy objects:</b> Bridging older APIs with modern property access</li>
547       * </ul>
548       *
549       * <h5 class='section'>Implementation Example:</h5>
550       * <p class='bjava'>
551       *    <jc>// Custom extractor for a specialized data class</jc>
552       *    PropertyExtractor <jv>customExtractor</jv> = (<jp>obj</jp>, <jp>property</jp>) -&gt; {
553       *       <jk>if</jk> (<jp>obj</jp> <jk>instanceof</jk> DatabaseEntity <jv>entity</jv>) {
554       *          <jk>switch</jk> (<jp>property</jp>) {
555       *             <jk>case</jk> <js>"id"</js>: <jk>return</jk> <jv>entity</jv>.getPrimaryKey();
556       *             <jk>case</jk> <js>"displayName"</js>: <jk>return</jk> <jv>entity</jv>.computeDisplayName();
557       *             <jk>case</jk> <js>"metadata"</js>: <jk>return</jk> <jv>entity</jv>.getMetadataAsMap();
558       *          }
559       *       }
560       *       <jk>return</jk> <jk>null</jk>; <jc>// Let next extractor try</jc>
561       *    };
562       *
563       *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>converter</jv> = BasicBeanConverter.<jsm>builder</jsm>()
564       *       .addPropertyExtractor(<jv>customExtractor</jv>)
565       *       .defaultSettings() <jc>// Adds standard extractors</jc>
566       *       .build();
567       * </p>
568       *
569       * <p><b>Execution Order:</b> Custom extractors are tried before the default extractors
570       * added by {@link #defaultSettings()}, allowing overrides of standard behavior.</p>
571       *
572       * @param e The property extractor to register
573       * @return This builder for method chaining
574       * @see PropertyExtractor
575       * @see PropertyExtractors
576       */
577      public Builder addPropertyExtractor(PropertyExtractor e) { propertyExtractors.add(e); return this; }
578
579      /**
580       * Adds default handlers and settings for common Java types.
581       *
582       * <p>This method registers comprehensive support for:</p>
583       * <ul>
584       *    <li><b>Collections:</b> List, Set, Collection → bracket format</li>
585       *    <li><b>Maps:</b> Map, Properties → brace format with key=value pairs</li>
586       *    <li><b>Map Entries:</b> Map.Entry → <js>"key=value"</js> format</li>
587       *    <li><b>Dates:</b> Date, Calendar → ISO-8601 format</li>
588       *    <li><b>Files/Streams:</b> File, InputStream, Reader → content extraction</li>
589       *    <li><b>Reflection:</b> Class, Method, Constructor → readable signatures</li>
590       *    <li><b>Enums:</b> All enum types → name() format</li>
591       *    <li><b>Iterables:</b> Iterable, Iterator, Enumeration, Stream → list conversion</li>
592       *    <li><b>Wrappers:</b> Optional, Supplier → unwrapping/evaluation</li>
593       * </ul>
594       *
595       * <p>Default settings include:</p>
596       * <ul>
597       *    <li><code>nullValue</code> = <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js></li>
598       *    <li><code>emptyValue</code> = <js>"&lt;empty&gt;"</js></li>
599       *    <li><code>classNameFormat</code> = <js>"simple"</js></li>
600       * </ul>
601       *
602       * <p><b>Note:</b> This should typically be called after custom handlers to avoid
603       * overriding your custom configurations, since handlers are processed in reverse order.</p>
604       *
605       * @return This builder for method chaining
606       */
607      public Builder defaultSettings() {
608         addSetting(SETTING_nullValue, "<null>");
609         addSetting(SETTING_selfValue, "<self>");
610         addSetting(SETTING_classNameFormat, "simple");
611
612         addStringifier(Map.Entry.class, Stringifiers.mapEntryStringifier());
613         addStringifier(GregorianCalendar.class, Stringifiers.calendarStringifier());
614         addStringifier(Date.class, Stringifiers.dateStringifier());
615         addStringifier(InputStream.class, Stringifiers.inputStreamStringifier());
616         addStringifier(byte[].class, Stringifiers.byteArrayStringifier());
617         addStringifier(Reader.class, Stringifiers.readerStringifier());
618         addStringifier(File.class, Stringifiers.fileStringifier());
619         addStringifier(Enum.class, Stringifiers.enumStringifier());
620         addStringifier(Class.class, Stringifiers.classStringifier());
621         addStringifier(Constructor.class, Stringifiers.constructorStringifier());
622         addStringifier(Method.class, Stringifiers.methodStringifier());
623         addStringifier(List.class, Stringifiers.listStringifier());
624         addStringifier(Map.class, Stringifiers.mapStringifier());
625
626         // Note: Listifiers are processed in reverse registration order (last registered wins).
627         // Collection must be registered after Iterable so it takes precedence for Sets,
628         // ensuring TreeSet conversion for deterministic ordering.
629         addListifier(Iterable.class, Listifiers.iterableListifier());
630         addListifier(Collection.class, Listifiers.collectionListifier());
631         addListifier(Iterator.class, Listifiers.iteratorListifier());
632         addListifier(Enumeration.class, Listifiers.enumerationListifier());
633         addListifier(Stream.class, Listifiers.streamListifier());
634         addListifier(Map.class, Listifiers.mapListifier());
635
636         addSwapper(Optional.class, Swappers.optionalSwapper());
637         addSwapper(Supplier.class, Swappers.supplierSwapper());
638         addSwapper(Future.class, Swappers.futureSwapper());
639
640         addPropertyExtractor(new PropertyExtractors.ObjectPropertyExtractor());
641         addPropertyExtractor(new PropertyExtractors.ListPropertyExtractor());
642         addPropertyExtractor(new PropertyExtractors.MapPropertyExtractor());
643
644         return this;
645      }
646
647      /**
648       * Builds the configured BasicBeanConverter instance.
649       *
650       * <p>This method creates a new BasicBeanConverter with all registered handlers
651       * and settings. The builder can be reused to create multiple converters with
652       * the same configuration.</p>
653       *
654       * @return A new BasicBeanConverter instance
655       */
656      public BasicBeanConverter build() {
657         return new BasicBeanConverter(this);
658      }
659   }
660
661   static class StringifierEntry<T> {
662      private Class<T> forClass;
663      private Stringifier<T> function;
664
665      private StringifierEntry(Class<T> forClass, Stringifier function) {
666         this.forClass = forClass;
667         this.function = function;
668      }
669   }
670
671   static class ListifierEntry<T> {
672      private Class<T> forClass;
673      private Listifier<T> function;
674
675      private ListifierEntry(Class<T> forClass, Listifier<T> function) {
676         this.forClass = forClass;
677         this.function = function;
678      }
679   }
680
681   static class SwapperEntry<T> {
682      private Class<T> forClass;
683      private Swapper<T> function;
684
685      private SwapperEntry(Class<T> forClass, Swapper<T> function) {
686         this.forClass = forClass;
687         this.function = function;
688      }
689   }
690}
